text: I finally caught them all and my knees
hurt my feet hurt my legs hurt and my
back hurts so I've been playing this
game since day one I've walked about 300
kilometres I caught all 142 Pokemon that
you can catch in the United States I
don't know why I just needed to get them
all I can't explain it I just had to
I've probably spent around 20 dollars in
the game in in app purchases those were
mostly towards egg incubators and bag
upgrades otherwise I only spent money on
a few taxis which I'm embarrassed to
admit you get this rush of adrenaline
you know it's fun you're running around
you're outside I like to explore the
city anyway and so this just gave me
something else to do while I was doing
that so when the game came out I didn't
know that much about it and I went out
and I shot a video demonstrating how to
play the game and what the game was
hilariously I can capture video man this
footage right here that night I went out
and played myself and ever since then I
was hooked it started out pretty casual
and then it turned into an obsession I
pretty much played all day so I'd wake
up check the app to see if there were
any Pokemon near my apartment if there
weren't I'd play it on the way to the
subway every day after work I'd go out
and I'd either go to Grand Army Plaza at
the southeast corner of Central Park or
Battery Park City I would spend maybe
four hours sitting in a spot or walking
around Grand Army Plaza in Central Park
turned out to be like the spot to be to
play Pokemon in New York even Justin
Bieber popped up there we went over to
Grand Army Plaza to film people playing
and Bieber pulled up right next to us he
didn't appreciate being filmed but it
was interesting to see him playing
Pokemon with all the other people and so
probably the craziest moment was when I
hopped in a cab to Central Park jumped
out and immediately sprinted to a
Snorlax which had about a minute left on
the timer before it would despawn
immediately after a crowd of people came
rushing over and they all wanted to see
my Snorlax there were times when a
Pokemon was like in a building like the
Natural History Museum but was closed so
I would see like crowds of people like
clawing at the wall and just trying to
get as close to the building as they
could I went on a Pokemon go bar crawl
in Brooklyn
one weekend and that was pretty intense
there weren't a lot of rare Pokemon on
the route but it didn't matter people
were just making friends and showing
each other their pokedex is in the end I
ended up catching a venusaur so it was
worth it I went with a friend up to
Inwood and the northern part of
Manhattan to look for a Dragon Knight
and actually just found a pack of skunks
when weekend I went on a bus trip to
Pennsylvania there were barely any pokey
stops and almost no Pokemon anywhere it
made me realize that if I didn't live in
New York that I probably wouldn't be
playing this game
it's laparis was my white whale of
Pokemon go I guess you could say blue
whale it does not appear very often the
only times I saw it were in the middle
of the ocean and I wasn't on a boat at
the time fortunately one appeared a few
blocks from our office with 15 minutes
to spare and that was my last Pokemon
I'll still play the game I won't be as
crazy about it as I was before I'll
probably just play casually as I'm
walking to and from the subway but I'm
not gonna go after certain pokemons I'm
not gonna run anymore unless it's the
Dragon Knight
